Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for ACM HotMobile 2015

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will support students at U.S. institutions to attend the Sixteenth Workshop on Mobile Computing Systems and Applications (ACM HotMobile 2015). HotMobile, sponsored by ACM SIGMOBILE, will be held in February, 2015 in Santa Fe, New Mexico. HotMobile 2015 is an important workshop targeting mobile computing and system integration fields and attending this event will benefit the scientific progress of the student's research. The exposure to the technical content of HotMobile 2015 will inspire students to address the tough problems in their respective fields, with a long-term benefit of scientific advances in these types of networks.

Priority will be given to students who will benefit from attending this workshop, but are unlikely to attend due to the unavailability of travel funding. In addition, applications from female and underrepresented groups in networking research will be strongly encouraged. Up to fourteen students will receive travel grants from this award to attend HotMobile 2015.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
The award has supported 18 graduate students in US institutions to attend ACM  HotMobile 2015 in Santa Fe, New Mexico, on Feb. 12 - 13th, 2015. Each student has either co-authored a paper in techincal sessions, or presented a poster or demo in the conference. 

 

Intellectual merits: The students who have received the awards were exposed to the wide variety of technical activities (keynote presentation, poster and demo sessions, paper presentations) offered by HotMobile, a premier workshop in mobile computing and system integration fields. Such exposure has inspired students to address tough problems in their field.  It also has generated a long-term benefit for students to pursue their future scientific progress for their works. 

 

Broad impacts: The award has generated substantial impact on the development of the supported graduate students. The funds have allowed them to attend the high-caliber technical presentations and interact with leading researchers and fellow students in this field. We have encouraged the parcitpation from groups under-represented in higher education. In particular, among the travel grant awardees, five of them are female graduate students. Attending HotMobile 2015 has provided an excellent opportunity for them to learn about hot topics in mobile systems and applications, open research problems, and possible career options after graduation.
